page.title: 12THE VILLAGE POST OFFICE
page.content: The post Office doubles as a shop and is more than 100 years old while the house itself is more than 150 years old.It was once a full sorting office and the store room was a telephone exchange.The present owners have extended the premises and have introduced new lines such as cards and cooked meats.They buy in stock fairly regularly as their storage space is quite limited.This is purchased locally in either Worcester or Malvern.The least busy day is Wednesday and they are closed on Sunday.The shop has a heavy commitment to the supply of newspapers.They supply 925 daily newspapers and 530 Worcester Evening News.They also take 300 magazines for various customers.It is very much a family concern and all members take a hand in helping out in the shop or the post office.
